questions.question_text: Insider threats can be detected by observing concerning behaviors exhibited by insiders, such as conflicts with supervisors and coworkers, decline in performance, tardiness or unexplained absenteeism. Select the technique that helps in detecting insider threats:

choices.D: Categorizing information according to its sensitivity and access rights
choices.C: Making is compulsory for employees to sign a none disclosure agreement
choices.A: Correlating known patterns of suspicious and malicious behavior
choices.B: Protecting computer systems by implementing proper controls
To define the notification procedures, damage assessments and offers the plan activation
choices.C: To provide the introduction and detailed concept of the contingency plan
choices.D: To provide a sequence of recovery activities with the help of recovery procedures
choices.A: To restore the original site, tests systems to prevent the incident and terminates operations

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
4.4 Reconstitution Phase
The Reconstitution Phase is the third and final phase of ISCP implementation and defines the actions
taken to test and validate system capability and functionality. During Reconstitution, recovery activities
are completed and normal system operations are resumed. If the original facility is unrecoverable, the
activities in this phase can also be applied to preparing a new permanent location to support system
processing requirements. This phase consists of two major activities: validating successful recovery and
deactivation of the plan
NO DISCUSSION ON THESE QUESTIONS.DOES IT MEAN THEY ARE ALL CORRECT

comments.content:
Agree. But I think A is the nearest.

A. To restore the original site, tests systems to prevent the incident and terminates operations -
B. To define the notification procedures, damage assessments and offers the plan activation (this is part of notification/activation)
C. To provide the introduction and detailed concept of the contingency plan (Supporting information??)
D. To provide a sequence of recovery activities with the help of recovery procedures (Recovery??)

questions.question_text: Contingency planning enables organizations to develop and maintain effective methods to handle emergencies. Every organization will have its own specific requirements that the planning should address. There are five major components of the IT contingency plan, namely supporting information, notification activation, recovery and reconstitution and plan appendices. What is the main purpose of the reconstitution plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
As per AI answer is C

Selected Answer: D
do not select B, it is completely wrong, all you need to do is read the book and little common sense

Selected Answer: D
The insider = malicious attacker. If the technical literacy is high and the process knowledge high then the risk is high because the malicious insider knows exactly what to do to cause harm.

Correct answer is B.
A technical insider who also knows the process will make things difficult for an attacker thereby reducing the significancwe of the threat

comments.content: They mean by insider is the attacker not the technical engineer so the answer is D

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is true

Answer is D.

A. If the insider's technical literacy is low and process knowledge is high, the risk posed by the threat will be insignificant. -> false. threat should be significant
B. If the insider's technical literacy and process knowledge are high, the risk posed by the threat will be insignificant. -> false. threat should be significant
C. If the insider's technical literacy is high and process knowledge is low, the risk posed by the threat will be high. -> false. threat is insignificant
D. If the insider's technical literacy and process knowledge are high, the risk posed by the threat will be high. -> correct
NO DISCUSSION ON THESE QUESTIONS.DOES IT MEAN THEY ARE ALL CORRECT

questions.question_text: The insider risk matrix consists of technical literacy and business process knowledge vectors. Considering the matrix, one can conclude that:

choices.C: If the insider's technical literacy is high and process knowledge is low, the risk posed by the threat will be high.
choices.A: If the insider's technical literacy is low and process knowledge is high, the risk posed by the threat will be insignificant.
choices.B: If the insider's technical literacy and process knowledge are high, the risk posed by the threat will be insignificant.
choices.D: If the insider's technical literacy and process knowledge are high, the risk posed by the threat will be high.

discussion.content: Where can I see that on the book?
NO DISCUSSION ON THESE QUESTIONS.DOES IT MEAN THEY ARE ALL CORRECT

questions.question_text: Which policy recommends controls for securing and tracking organizational resources:

choices.C: Eradication - Containment - Identification - Preparation - Recovery - Follow-up
choices.B: Preparation - Identification - Containment - Eradication - Recovery - Follow-up
choices.D: Identification - Preparation - Containment - Recovery - Follow-up - Eradication
choices.A: Containment - Identification - Preparation - Recovery - Follow-up - Eradication

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is the correct sequence of flow of the stages in an incident response:

discussion.content:
B: I always learned it as PICERL
Preparation, Identification, Containment, Eradication, Recovery, Lessons Learned
